document.masterDocTitle: Salinadaptatus halalkaliphilus gen. nov., sp. nov., a haloalkaliphilic archaeon isolated from salt pond in Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Salinadaptatus halalkaliphilus gen. nov., sp. nov., a haloalkaliphilic archaeon isolated from salt pond in Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, China
International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

subSubSection.paragraph:
Salinadaptatus
(Sa.lin.a.dap.ta′ tus. L. fem. pl. n. salinae salterns, salt works; L. part. adj. adaptatus adapted to a thing; N.L. masc. n.
Salinadaptatus
an archaeon adapted to salt.) Colonies are pink-pigmented. Cells are chemoorganotrophic, Gram-stain-negative, rod and contain PG and PGP-Me as its major phospholipids. No glycolipids were detected. Growth occurs in a wide range of substrates. This genus is phylogenetically included in the family

tableNote.paragraph: +, Positive; −, negative; PG, Phosphatidylglycerol; PGP-Me, phosphatidylglycerol phosphate methyl ester; PGP, phosphatidylglycerophosphate; PL, phospholipids; S 2 - DGD,
disulfated mannosyl glucosyl diether; DGE, dialkyl glycerol ether; ND, no detection.

caption.paragraph: Table 2. Physiological and genomic characteristics of the strain XQ-INN 246T and the type strains from closely related genera Strains: 1, XQ-INN 246T (data from this study); 2, Natrarchaeobius chitinivorans AArcht4T; 3, Natrialba asiatica 172P1T; 4, Natronorubrum bangense CGMCC 1.1984T; 5, Natronolimnohabitans innermongolicus CGMCC 1.2124T; 6, Halostagnicola larsenii CGMCC 1.5338T. +, Positive; −, negative; PG, Phosphatidylglycerol; PGP-Me, phosphatidylglycerol phosphate methyl ester; PGP, phosphatidylglycerophosphate; PL, phospholipids; S2- DGD, disulfated mannosyl glucosyl diether; GS, genome sequence; DGE, dialkyl glycerol ether; Tm, melting temperature; ND, no detection. Data for Nlh. innermongolicus CGMCC 1.2124T were taken from Itoh et al . [29, 30]. Data for Nar. chitinivorans AArcht4T were taken from [32]. Data for Nrr. bangense CGMCC 1.1984T were taken from [4]. Data for Nab. asiatica 172P1T was taken from [5]. Data for Hst. larsenii CGMCC 1.5338T was taken from [33].

subSubSection.paragraph:
Natrialbaceae
, order
Natrialbales
, class
Halobacteria
. The recommended three-letter abbreviation is Sad .

The type species is
Salinadaptatus halalkaliphilus
.
